column4: Okay, I screwed up my install, bad I think. I can't seem to burn a good cdr so I did a netboot install. I have no GUI, and no idea how to get it. Hints?
Alright, well, first thing, do you get a prompt, and can you login?
yes. I'm quite sure this part is okay, man, sudo and shutdown work.
alright, you were installing Ubuntu? or kubuntu or what?  We'll just see if our install of that goes without a hitch
Ubuntu desktop
alright, so, `sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop`
Oh. that would install gnome.
the screen quit scrolling and I'm back to a prmpt. How to start gnome?
try ctrl-alt-f7 to get to GDM, if not, make sure gdm is running, sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
thank you
you should have just asked.  And, on top of that, it started automatically after you installed it.
I guess I'm a glutton. a LAMP stack should have been cake work for me.
there's a howto about it.  Did you find that?  Are you already all setup?
Yes just found it.
mousepad
You having problems connecting to the repositories?
I'm playing with tunneling X via ssh, tunneling xterm feels kinda dumb.
6.10 is EOL, you really ought to upgrade, by the way.
Yeah, I just went through it on my desktop, Kinda antsy about doing the server. Thanks for reminding me.
Thank You.
Ban Evasion, see ProNoob.
Not quite.
